Let them play normals all they want, but give them a timeout for purposely ruining my ranked experience. Ranked is where the toxicity rly shows itself anyways...

* If user is considered AFK through System, AFK gains triple the LP loss while teammates only lose 50% of LP for loss including a ban for 2 hours. If user is AFK within 7 days after 1st offence, 2nd offence follows a 24 hour ban and 3rd offence being 1 week.
* If 7 out of the 10 player agree on one player for feeding, that user will be banned for 7 days and gain triple the LP loss, while teammates receive only lose 50% of LP instead 100%.
* For example, instead of -16 LP it will be -8 LP for losing, while the Feeder/AFK would lose 60 LP if he/she was originally going to lose 20 LP.
* All bans only involve Ranked. NOT NORMALS.

Wait why is it harsher for Feeders then AFKers? I think you have it reversed, AFKing should be waaay harsher then feeding. Sometimes you just have a bad game, someone is just that much better, or you are not getting any help from team. As long as they are actively trying to do better i do not think its fair to ban them. You say 7 out of 10, but whether they were really trying to win or not those 7 will still report them.  

Personally i think there is no excuse for AFK unless you were lagged out and can prove it.
  
*  AFKing should be 24 hour ban from League.  

*  You lose ALL your LP, if you had less then what you normally would have lost it drops you down a division.  

*  If you AFK again within 7 days, 30 day ban from Ranked. AFKing again within 10 days of 30 day ban is permanent ban from Ranked.  

*  If you can be proven to have purposely fed then 24 hour ban from Ranked and double LP loss.

Well I guess that's debatable. People get problems with their internet, computer, or a roommate causing problems or an emergency happens. While feeders are just trolling you to lose on purpose. But either way this system or any of the like would be awesome and quite easy to implement for Riot. It depends if they have the balls to do it. It won't affect casual normal play so I dont see the problem with it. Ranked is for competitive players that actually care about winning. And hopefully Riot can see that.
its intentional feeding though, which usually is very obvious. someone can get stomped on and constantly assassinated, but someone who walks face first into the enemy team is different.

No.  Reason #1 Comcast Internet.  Reason #2 Life Happens.  So what I am supposed to send in a copy of the wanted poster into riot because my dog rank away and I had to put my ranked game on hold? Even if that is the case will I get my 24 hours back? How can you tell who is telling the truth and who is abusing the system? It is already a pretty terrible feeling to have to step away from a ranked game, and I think that such harsh penalties will lead to poor decision making IRL.

sometimes peoples' power goes out, internet service in their area or neighborhood may be experiencing issues, someone may have attacked their IP address, they may have had an emergency pop up etc. all of those things can be unpredictable, so saying, "well don't play then" could imply one Never plays since those things can  happen unexpectedly. that would be the reasoning of a paranoid agoraphobe, applied to logging into and playing a game rather than stepping outside their comfort zone. just apply the full loss to the afk (who if it is legit rage quitting or trolling aren't hurt through being on a 'smurf' account to troll or a main tdgaf about since they rage quit often likely) and then half the loss to the team, for no more than 2 times every 6 or even 24 hours a person being eligable for that btw. to prevent abuse. or believe me, your matches would become worse faster than barry allen could pants you , with everyone and their uncle attempting to abuse the system in some way or trolling for the sake of trolling a mass of players who would suddenly feel safe. that's the goal of trolling these days, to shock the hell out of you and/or make you madder than a hatter. 


This is very important to read if you didn't read the rest of that plaster, in hon you could vote kick players. that ran plenty of new players off of the game, between that and them having the biggest bunch of nerd ragers in the genre or even online gaming period. if you incorporate a 'vote' system into the game, you add more toxicity. period. there is a report system, and an honor system. we do NOT need a in-match vote system in place, in this game. please take my word for it. don't give the trolls and crybabies ammunition.  I must quote the great Al Bundy on that idea, and simply say, "No Ma'am!"
I'd say that the same 7/10 people agreeing thing should apply to the AFK part as well, because its possible that it was just a DC, not a full on AFK.

I really don't agree with what you say. Let's be real, if you think about it hard enough, the times that YOUR team gets afks are the same as your opponents getting an AFK, right? And let's be honest, when the other team afks, do you actually feel bad for them? No! I would feel extremely happy for the "free" win. And people who play ranked, they aren't afk'ing because they want to ruin your life! They don't even know you!! Sometimes people just have to afk, it's an emergency. Sure, there are people who say, "I'm done, this adc sucks" and goes afk. But come on, your opponents have those people too! An equal amount. It just seems more on your team because you actually care when people afk on your team. And people being toxic? People have bad games. They can get irritated. It happens. People are different. But you know what? To be offended by a complete stranger that you'll never ever meet again...is not a good thing. So I think the system now is fine. That's all.

I would say there should be more done about people who are toxic and/or intentionally ruin the game. I'd much rather play with someone who is bad but is trying than a more skilled player who insults and ragers at their whole team.

SERIOUSLY! I've had so many games where people would complain about not getting their spot when they are last pick and then they pick the lane they want anyway even thought the person ahead of them already picked it.
You're not in elo hell.  Carry your own damn way out of bronze.

I hate when people think that EVERYONE can carry games, and I also hate it when people (probably much like yourself) think that you did every dang thing in the game and that your teammates didn't help at all! NOT EVERYONE CAN CARRY THEIR GAMES BUT THEY SURE AS HELL CAN HELP OTHER PEOPLE CARRY THEM! I don't see any reason for someone to be stuck in bronze because people decide that they want to troll that day. That is all, I'm done.

But following that logic you're opponents have an equal chance to be stuck with trolls; so if you play 1000 games and lose half of those, statistics imply that you are very average and/or comparable to the people you are playing with/against. Unless you're only playing support roles.
Lemonnation held the #1 spot in Challenger tier and got there only playing support characters.

Actually, you'd have a better chance than the opponent considering that it would be 4 chances to get a troll as opposed to 5. (4 people+you, 5 opponents). the only way it becomes 100% 50/50 chance is if you decide at some point to troll as well. (be that in response to another troll or not)
100% agree with this guy.
You cant punish someone for not being skilled. That would be ridiculous. And if you are playing with unskilled players, that most likely means that you are also unskilled.

I sort of agree with you, you can not punish someone for not being good. The only part i disagree with is being stuck in Bronze or Silver because you cant carry a team that is clearly not as skilled as you or the enemy team.  

I actually run into this problem a lot, specially in my Promo series, i do pretty good in lane and in team fights. I just dont main champs that can literally carry a team by killing the other team faster then they can kill us. As a support i try to support by either peeling or CCing or just sustaining but my efforts are not always followed up on or taken advantage of. As a tank i try to peel or take CC or even open up/kill their carries but it doesnt mean my team will follow up or take advantage of it.  

Not saying im super good because im not, its just i find myself in the position of having to carry my team alot or being the leader because they dont seem to know what to do. Sometimes it just turns out im the only lane that won or isnt negative.
